Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: @siu - Chainmakers  You will need to force thorugh blocks... MM by default needs 3 blocks, but AC OnDemand only mines a single... and as all of us that were force mining empty bocks on AC pretty much stopped... The chains that are onDemand will now get stuck.

Content: likely they made it so some key functionality of rpc call that was working for almost 10 years is totally changed

Content: like signtransaction no longer working the way it used to

Content: or getinfo being deprecated

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or validateaddress having new functionality, but some other "new" rpc call behaving as validateaddress has been working

Content: on and on I can go

Content: BTC core is intentioanally breaking the rpc

Content: torvalds said it best about not breaking userspace

It's updated to the latest marketmaker build by @artem.pikulin https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/releases and the coin config is defined so it uses the Sapling fork https://github.com/CoinCollect/dicoapp-e/commit/3399917329aa65b581ade6b5a0ac3cafb0274b28

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content:
MM2 is not really usable currently, it lacks ETH/ERC20 and Electrum support. New swap functions don't currently save the state of swap to filesystem so in case of abortion swap will be stuck. It's planned to finish ETH and Electrum support on next week. So I think we will have something testable in January. The guide  https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/tree/mm2-dice#cmake-build-of-marketmaker-with-linked-etomic-lib-for-etherc20-atomic-swaps is outdated.
Actually we have "old style ETH/ERC20/Electrum" nightly builds here: http://195.201.0.6/etomic/, however these might contain same issues as actual release build from my fork.

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: @artem.pikulin Thank you very much for all this information. Great to hear that it is so far already!

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: (if you have additions, please share. there can't be enough shared about mm2 )

Author: artem.pikulin#0794
Content: @bartwr You're welcome, just to be more clear: http://195.201.0.6/etomic/ - you can try the latest build from here, it was done `before` swap protocol refactor and ETH/Electrum support removal. Also some UTXO validation on order matching is removed in these so maybe `alice not eligible` won't happen. But anyway: `use at your own risk`.
